details.description:
Ian wears many hats in the Raleigh-Durham Community and beyond. He is known for his leadership and willingness to step in and help a cause. When he is not wrangling open data Ian keeps himself busy with tech companies, civic engagement organizations and several non-profits.

Tech companies that Ian manages are a technology policy think tank, a node of the Open Data Institute and an app startup. Ian also participates in local and regional economic development organizations and focuses on how trends like new technologies, shared work spaces, open data and civic engagement are driving new economic opportunities.

In the civic engagement arena, Ian organizes Triangle Open Data Day, NC DataPalooza, several StartUp Weekends and is a Brigade Captain for the local Code for America Brigade. As a participant, Ian has competed in CityCamp NC, NC DataPalooza and a Metlife TechJam. Ian advocates the potential of technology minded civic activists and their positive impact on government efficiency, constituent services and quality of life.

Ian has experience in multiple corporate functions and industries and a passion for multicultural engagements allowing him to see the big picture and to develop products and processes to best fit that picture.
